Column Comment.0: SEISMIC SET SUBTYPE: The seismic set type column is used to enforce arelationship between the SEIS SET supertype and its valid sub types. Values for thiscolumn must be the name of the table that is the valid sub type for this row of data.Valid entries may be SEIS_LINE, SEIS_SEGMENT, SEIS_SURVEY or SEIS_3D.
Column Comment.1: SEISMIC SET: A seismic set is a super type of various types of seismic collections.Valid types of seismic sets are SEIS_LINE, SEIS_3D, SEIS_SEGMENT andSEIS_SURVEY.
Column Comment.2: SEISMIC SUMMARY OBSERVATION NUMBER: Unique identifier for theobservation of a seismic summary record. The number is reset to 1 each time a newSEIS SET is referenced.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: 3D SIZE: the size of the area where the seismic set is not linear.
Column Comment.6: CDP COVERAGE: Common Depth Point nominal subsurface coverage (600%, 1200% etc.)
Column Comment.7: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.8: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.9: FIRST NLINE NUMBER: The number of the first nline in the seismic set.
Column Comment.10: FIRST SEISMIC POINT ID: part of a foreign key from SEIS POINT. This columnindicates the first point on a seismic set and is used to identify the seismic set.Populate this procedurally after SEIS POINT has been loaded.
Column Comment.11: FIRST XLINE NUMBER: The number of the first xline in the seismic set.
Column Comment.12: LAST NLINE NUMBER: The number of the last nline in the seismic set.
Column Comment.13: LAST SEISMIC POINT ID: part of a foreign key from SEIS POINT. This columnindicates the last point on a seismic set and is used to identify the seismic set.Populate this procedurally after SEIS POINT has been loaded.
Column Comment.14: LAST XLINE NUMBER: The number of the last xline in the seismic set.
Column Comment.15: LINE LENGTH: The length of a 2D line represented between the first and last pointsthat are identified.
Column Comment.16: LINE LENGTH OUOM: Usually KM or Miles
Column Comment.17: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.18: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.19: SEISMIC STATION TYPE: seismic station type such as CDP, source, receiver etc
Column Comment.20: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.21: SEISMIC SUMMARY TYPE: The reason why or kind of seismic summary that hasbeen created, such as a mapping summary, one based on CDP, one based onownership or some kind of activity.
Column Comment.22: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.23: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.24: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.25: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.26: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.27: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.28: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
